title: I can't seem to figure out this font. Help?
content:
Greetings!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015163829im_/http:/typophile.com/files/probiont-newsmall_6742.jpg)
  
My friend has asked me to identify the font in the picture I attached.  
I have tried [www.whatfontis.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015163829/http:/www.whatfontis.com/ "www.whatfontis.com") and [www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015163829/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont "www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont") but I cannot find what I'm looking for.  
Maybe you guys have used this type before in the past.  
Sorry for the trouble, and thank you very much for your help! :)
author: andzero

comments.content: can you tell us where your sample came from?

Hi, the sample is from an old .jpg image for T-Shirt design..  
The .psd file is already lost and he asked for my assistance.

The closest is (I think) FF Cocon Regular, or Mic32 New Rounded Medium with some edits.  
The most notable difference is the uppercase 'M' character (those two touches the baseline).
